thread.section_title: Oklahoma Sooners News - Sports News for Dallas, Texas
thread.title: Sooners' trip to K-State includes four planes, delay of eight-plus hours
thread.title_full: Sooners' trip to K-State includes four planes, delay of eight-plus hours | Dallas Morning News

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: Sooners' trip to K-State includes four planes, delay of eight-plus hours
text:
The Oklahoma Sooners left campus at 2 p.m. Friday for Oklahoma City's Will Rogers World Airport, where they boarded a flight to Manhattan, Kan., ahead of Saturday's game against Kansas State.
Just another business trip, right?
Wheels up to the Little Apple! #Sooners âœï¸ðŸ pic.twitter.com/ochycchqse
— Oklahoma Football (@OU_Football) October 16, 2015 Their planes -- yes, that's plural -- had other ideas.
According to The Oklahoman , the Sooners' 2:45 p.m. departure was delayed by a late-arriving plane, and again later by mechanical issues.
#Sooners off routine. Supposed to have walk-thru practice @KSU by now. Rather, plane on Tarmac since 2:40 w engine probs. 6 hrs late! #OU
— Dean Blevins (@DeanBlevins) October 16, 2015
The #Sooners are still at the OKC airport. Left campus at 2 pm for the airport. Would be here by now if they'd driven
— Jason Kersey (@jasonkersey) October 17, 2015 But the problems only continued with the arrival of a backup plane.
Unbelievably, the back up plane that was on its way to take #OU team to #KSU now has its own mechanical problems. No idea when we will leave
— Dean Blevins (@DeanBlevins) October 17, 2015
Gotta imagine this will factor in the next time @OU_Athletics is signing a contract with an airline. United is awful.
— Jason Kersey (@jasonkersey) October 17, 2015 And here's the kicker:
#Sooners paid United Airlines $623,000 for football flights this season.
— John Shinn (@john_shinn) October 17, 2015
Stoops and Co not happy campers. He told me "never had anything happen this bad--Had 2 drive from Lubbock once." pic.twitter.com/oIMm7HEjxj
— Dean Blevins (@DeanBlevins) October 17, 2015 Option No. 3? Forget about it.
How about the fourth one?
Joe Mixon rolling around Tarmac. Say prayers for safe flight. 4 mechanical probs w 4 planes. A record. #sooners pic.twitter.com/gvOUc8UXQ0
— Dean Blevins (@DeanBlevins) October 17, 2015 Yikes.
Eventually, No. 4 got the job done. Eventually .
8 hours & 16 mins after boarding, plane No. 4 has wheels rolling on #OU charter to KSU. Wonder how Bobby Knight would've handled? #Sooners
— Dean Blevins (@DeanBlevins) October 17, 2015 Before takeoff, standout linebacker Eric Striker made sure to let the pilot know how he felt about boarding a functioning plane after a delay of more than eight hours.
Pretty cool ... Eric Striker caught the pilot who brought in the back-up plane as he came down the stairs and thanked him.
— Kenny Mossman (@Kenny_Mossman) October 17, 2015 Here's to hoping the return trip is a little easier.
After a long day we have officially touched down in Manhattan. Thank you to the crew who got us here safely. We thank you.
— Oklahoma Football (@OU_Football) October 17, 2015 Oklahoma-Kansas State is scheduled for a 2:30 p.m. kickoff.
